intro: Mezoneuron intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate mezoneuron, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its biennial growth habit. The plant features slender, upright stems with finely divided leaves that resemble those of other umbelliferous plants. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the family, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Mezoneuron intermedium is often found in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils.
